repository.name: k6
repository.description: A modern load testing tool, using Go and JavaScript

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

body:
as I mentioned in the internal discussion, I am for disabling both github and cdnjs magic urls and the schemeless remote ones as well, but add a flag to enable them (I would argue we don't need separate flags). Have it this way for ... a year and drop them altogether.
Obviously we will need to also remove them from the documentation and make certain all our *-to-k6 tools generate only scripts not using both. 
We will probably also have some logic that if you run an archive created from before the version we release that the flag is ON instead of OFF but we still print a warning ...

rename.from: Consider dropping support for CDNJS loader
rename.to: Remove magic resolution of modules imports from CDNJS/GitHub

body:
I have update the issue to reflect the current consensus of going forward with removing this magical resolution.

For v0.51.0 we will be adding a warning. Anc currently plan to drop it in 0.53.0

issue.body:
## What?

Deprecate magic resolving of cdnjs and github "URLs"

## Why?

As part of #1408 we are first going to deprecate it for a couple of versions and then remove it.

issue.title: Remove magic resolving of cdnjs and github "URLs"

repository.name: k6
repository.description: A modern load testing tool, using Go and JavaScript

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
## What?

Drop support for cdnjs and github special URLs and their resolution

## Why?

Both of those are confusing and the github is even leading to 404 if you try to copy paste it.

There isn't really a good reason for this special treatment as both sites also provide perfectly normal URLs that can be used.


## Checklist
